intro: Costus curcumoides, commonly known as the golden costus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features tall, narrow leaves and produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The botanical characteristics of Costus curcumoides make it a distinctive and valuable species in both horticulture and ethnobotany.
